title: OHSAS 18001:2007 - Occupational Health & Safety Management
headline: Learn critical data about the health and safety management system with OSHAS 18001 in this free online course.
description: Occupational health and management systems have been existing for many years. Within their presence, companies ensure the protection and well-being of their employees. OSHAS 18001 is one such standard that presents companies and organizations worldwide with the requirements of establishing and maintaining an occupational health and management system. This short course teaches you more about the OHSMS requirements given in OSHAS 18001.

courseDescription:
Accidents and incidents are common in companies and workplaces. This makes the presence of a fully functioning health and management system necessary. With such a system in place, companies can safeguard their employees’ health better. In this regard, various standards and regulations have been enacted. And one such series is the OSHAS 18000. This standard was legislated back in 1999, and since then, it has helped many companies establish and maintain fully-fledged occupational health and safety management systems within their frameworks.

With this course, developers have tried to make OSHAS 18001 uncomplicated. After enrolling in this course, we will first introduce you to OSHAS 18001 and the benefits of its certification for companies. We will present a comprehensive explanation of Clause 4, which is the main clause of this standard. As you work through the pages of this course’s topics, you will gain a thorough understanding of each clause of Clause 4.

To help maintain enrollees’ interest, we have included various graphics and images throughout the course. Each topic has questions to test your knowledge of the content you have learned. A final summary will reinforce what you have discovered. After completing this course, you can also take a quick assessment to obtain the Alison certificate.
